summary: This bill, the Content Origin Protection and Integrity from Edited and Deepfaked Media Act of 2025, aims to increase transparency around the origin and modification of digital content, particularly regarding artificial intelligence-generated or modified content (deepfakes). It mandates the development of standards for content provenance information (metadata about origin) and detection of synthetic content. The bill also prohibits the removal or alteration of provenance information and restricts the use of covered content with removed provenance information, unless express consent is obtained. It assigns enforcement authority to the Federal Trade Commission, State Attorney Generals and grants rights to private parties for violations .
